Package dk.dtu.compute.se.pisd.roborally.controller

Class AppController

java.lang.Object
dk.dtu.compute.se.pisd.roborally.controller.AppController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class AppController extends Object implements Observer
The AppController is responsible for handling implementation logic about the App such as start,load,save,exit the gameApp.
Author:
Ekkart Kindler, ekki@dtu.dk

    • stopGame

      public boolean stopGame()
      Stop playing the current game, giving the user the option to save the game or to cancel stopping the game. The method returns true if the game was successfully stopped (with or without saving the game); returns false, if the current game was not stopped. In case there is no current game, false is returned.
      Returns:
      true if the current game was stopped, false otherwise

    • exit

      public void exit()
      this methode should provide the player to close the app

    • isGameRunning

      public boolean isGameRunning()
      this methode checks if the game is running
      Returns:
      the gameController of the running game ,otherwise return the false

    • update

      public void update(Subject subject)
      Description copied from interface: Observer
      The observer's update method, which is called, when the subject changes. The subject is provided as a parameter in order to use the same observer object as an observer for many different subjects.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      subject - the subject which changed
